Facts and Figures                       Traditions                                                                   Diversity At NYU       Since our founding in 1831, NYU’s history has been marked as “open to all”. Now as a university that is in and of the city and in and of the world, we continually strive to foster a dynamic and rigorous teaching and learning environment that represents a diversity of viewpoints. As a community of scholars (faculty, students, and staff) that is inclusive of divergent backgrounds and historically underrepresented groups, NYU engages a diversity of viewpoints, perspectives, and approaches.                                          COMMUNITY SPOTLIGHTS                               NYU Professors Talk LGBTQ Health                               Black Renaissance Noire & The Institute of African American Affairs Present:   READINGS & RECEPTION                                 Black Performance Theory 2015                                  Safe Zone I: LGBTQ 101                               Low Power to the People: Pirates, Protest, and Politics in FM Radio Activism                                 The Colloquium for Unpopular Culture Presents: Our Hobby is Depeche Mode                 DIVERSITY RESOURCES                                 STUDENTS          There's a wide range of resources and services for students at our locations in New York and throughout the world.                               FACULTY          At NYU, we offer various resources and support for our diverse community of faculty.                                 STAFF          NYU provides a number of opportunities and support for our dedicated staff who contribute to the success of our university.
